titleStmt.title: Description of Free Library of Philadelphia Lewis O 28: Dalāʼil al-khayrāt wa shawāriq al-anwār fī dhikr al-ṣalāh ʻalá al-nabī al-mukhtār.

availability.licence: These images and the content of Rare Book Department Lewis O 28: Dalāʼil al-khayrāt wa shawāriq al-anwār fī dhikr al-ṣalāh ʻalá al-nabī al-mukhtār. are free of known copyright restrictions and in the public domain. To the extent possible under law, Free Library of Philadelphia, Special Collections has waived all copyright and related or neighboring rights to this metadata about Rare Book Department Lewis O 28: Dalāʼil al-khayrāt wa shawāriq al-anwār fī dhikr al-ṣalāh ʻalá al-nabī al-mukhtār.. This work is published from: United States. For a summary of CC0, see https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/. Legal code: https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/legalcode.

msContents.summary: Collection of prayers for the Prophet Muḥammad and other devotional materials such as a description of his tomb and lists of his names and honorary epithets, divided into 60 sections to be read daily over 2 months.

msItem.title: Dalāʼil al-khayrāt wa shawāriq al-anwār fī dhikr al-ṣalāh ʻalá al-nabī al-mukhtār.
دلائل الخيرات و شوارق الانوار في ذكر الصلوة على النبي المختار

author.name: Free Library of Philadelphia. Rare Book Department. John Frederick Lewis collection of Oriental Manuscripts

msItem.title: Dalāʼil al-khayrāt wa shawāriq al-anwār fī dhikr al-ṣalāh ʻalá al-nabī al-mukhtār.

supportDesc.extent: 104 leaves : 165 x 95 (105 x 60) mm bound to 167 x 110 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Modern foliation added, top left recto; catchwords every verso, lower left.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in naskh in black ink; pointed and vocalized.

decoDesc.decoNote: Rubrications in red. First two openings (f. 1v-3r) have headpieces in gold, two shades of blue, pink and white with the text in cloudbands; textblock is border-ruled in double gold rules; punctuating the text are gold roundels with many different central designs in black surrounded by pink and blue dots. Two full-page illustrations, in perspective, of Mecca (f. 15v) and the Rawḍah in Medina (f. 16r) in polychrome water colors, framed in gold with pink floriated corners also appear. Colophon is written in cloudbands in a pink framed circular medallion set in a gold rectangle with fruit designs.
Grid of octagons and squares with names of Prophet

binding.p: Bound in dark brown leather over pasteboard with flap (Type II) with gold tooled chessboard-design central panel and double frame. Flap has coordinating gold tooled frame and dots. Lime green paper pastedowns. Spine and foredge hinge are lighter brown leather.

origin.p: Copy completed by Aḥmad al-Naẓīfī, a student of Ḥusayn al-Wahbī Afandi, in 1131 (1719) (f. 104r).

history.provenance: Gift of Anne Baker Lewis in 1933.
Formerly owned by al-Shaykh al-Ḥājj Muḥammad Shams al-Dīn Nūrī, a member of the Naqshband Sufi order (inscription on f. 104v).
Formerly owned by Adʹham al-Waṣfī Nūrī (owner's stamp, f. 1r).
Formerly owned by John Frederick Lewis.

surface.n: Inside back cover flap open to show design
Back cover flap opened to show design
